captions.text:
And we're gettin' a picture on the T.V. This
is Houston, we're copying. It's one, small

step for man... one, giant leap, for mankind.
You understand what the federation is, don't

you? When you feel like you were meant for
something better... something special. There

is greatness in you. Enlist in Starfleet.
They say time is the fire in which we burn.

If there is to be a brave new world, our generation
is going to have the hardest time living in

it. Fascinating. I may throw up on you. Son
of a bitch. Emergency session - suit up Kirk.

Weapon systems and shields on standby. Confirmed,
sir. Scotty? Don't you worry, captain. Maneuvering

thrusters Mr. Sulu. Maneuvering thrusters.
Hold station. Lights. Space... the final frontier.

Warp speed - engage. Punch it. These are the
voyages of the Starship Enterprise. Engines

at maximum warp. Their ongoing mission: to
explore strange new worlds. Come on Bones,

it's gonna be fun. To seek out new life-forms.
Oh my God. And new civilizations... and boldly

go where no one has gone before. Now... shall
we begin. Darkness is coming. Who is this?

Do you know the klingon proverb that tells
us revenge is a dish that is best served cold?

It is very cold in space. I'm sorry. If there
is one constant in this whole universe, it's
death. You think you are safe... You are not.
I believe in you, Jim... but there's not an ounce of humility in you.
You're afraid. I'm afraid of nothing.
And you're going to get yourself, and everyone under your command, killed.

These are the voyages of the Starship Enterprise. Your ongoing mission: to explore strange, new worlds... seek out new lifeforms, and new civilizations... and boldly go where
no one has gone before.

comments.text:
For as much as I love the TNG era, I have to admit that the TNG movies 
really didn't quite seem to fit into this saga trailer. I think if they had 
done this a little differently, it would have fit so much better. From the 
start this seemed like the main focus was on Kirk's Star Trek. Had it been 
about Star Trek in general, I think it would have been much more seamless 
for TNG.

comments.author: Sven Thore Prytz

comments.text:
I grew up watching TOG and I loved it. TNG was not that enjoyable to me. 
Especially with that phrase" In theory..bla bla bla" And those stupid 
replicators. I lost all interest on the spin offs due to this. I did start 
to enjoy Enterprise though. The JJ. Abrams movies are way too good. I love 
them and watch them often.
comments.author: Manny Ramirez

comments.text: I agree with you 100%
comments.author: Manny Ramirez

comments.text:
+Manny Ramirez my favorite of all of them is Star Trek: the Motion Picture, 
and I love 2,3,&4 equally. After that, it's all down hill. Frakes did a 
decent job with First Contact, but none of the Next Gen movies even came 
close to what made the series great. In fact, they actively destroyed the 
characters. They kept trying to turn Picard into an action hero... Which 
was the opposite of who he was. 
The Abrams movies certainly put some oomph back in Trek, but the last movie 
was a serious misstep. They should have done something wholly original.
comments.author: Christopher Butler

comments.text:
I also love to hear Greenwood's "There's greatness in you, but there's not 
an ounce of humility" and McDowell's "They say time is which we burn, Right 
now Captain, my time is running out"
comments.author: Manny Ramirez

comments.text:
I hate to ask this...DO you pefer?
TOG movies
TNG movies 
or
Reboot movies?
comments.author: Manny Ramirez

comments.text: @.@ Ho...ly... F$%&! AWESOME!﻿
comments.author: Star Trek Community

comments.text:
Actually, I don't mind the alternate canon. The first reboot established 
it's own universe in thoroughly Term style. The issue with ID is that it's 
a chaotic mess where the crew deal with conflict at the end of a phaser. 
There's trite fan service stapled on just because. It isn't good Trek, but 
it also falls apart as a movie.
comments.author: Nikos Carcosa (Dimber-Damber)

comments.text:
I've certainly seen individual episodes worse than Insurrection. Data/Lore 
anyone?
comments.author: Nikos Carcosa (Dimber-Damber)

comments.text:
It's certainly worse Trek than ST:TMP. TMP may have been a slog, but at 
least it was a Trek movie. ID can't make that claim. It's about as far from 
Trek as one can get. 

I still haven't seen a single cogent argument about why I Insurrection gets 
so much hate. It's a well executed, competent Next Gen story that raises 
good questions about the Prime Directive. All hallmarks of good Trek.
comments.author: Nikos Carcosa (Dimber-Damber)

comments.text:
yes, Into Darkness was a bit too action-y for Star Trek, and i do wish that 
the villain was more original, but it is still enjoyable. the worst Star 
Trek movie i think is The Motion Picture, that piece of crap is boring as 
hell, and even though Insurrection and Nemesis were also bad, at least they 
didn't show 5 minutes of retarded staring into blue light or whatever. 
Wrath of Khan and First Contact will always be the best, but to say STID is 
worse than the Motion Picture is madness
comments.author: Bob Baggins

comments.text:
Loved the first Abrams Trek. Into Darkness... less so. The big reveal of 
who Cumberbatch really is was ridiculous. To intentionality draw 
comparisons to Wrath of Khan is either arrogant or stupid.

There were too many explosions to really tell a story. You realize that 
Pines-Kirk has less experience than Wesley Crusher? Crazy.

Abrams is a capable director, and the first reboot movie showed promise, 
but ID showed that he doesn't really understand Trek. I think he'll kick 
ass as a Star Wars director, though.
comments.author: Nikos Carcosa (Dimber-Damber)

comments.text:
Insurrection gets a lot of unnecessary hate. Fine cast, nifty story. It's 
like a 2 hour episode. Nemesis less so, but still not worthy of the venom.
comments.author: Nikos Carcosa (Dimber-Damber)

comments.text:
+Rose Charpentier if you consider Into Darkness worse than Insurrection and 
Nemesis, you have a problem, because those were TERRIBLE! the new one isnt 
like the old Star Trek for sure, but its enjoyable fun.
comments.author: Bob Baggins

comments.text: This. Kicks. Ass.﻿
comments.author: Umesh Thota
